page.title: 15Bildeston Teacher's Day
page.content: Up by 5.45am after a welcome cup of coffee.I tackled the ironing of some early 1900 nightdresses and camisoles in preparation for a Byegones Museum to be held on the following Sunday at the Village Open Gardens Day. At 7.30 I took my husband to work at Wattisham Airfield.Just a poached egg,toast and marmalade and orange juice sufficed for breakfast and then at 8.35 I left for school,a mile away. Thursday is my duty day,so I waited for the bus which brings the children from the villages. There was one irate parent whose child did not wish to say goodbye. At 9.00am I was in the classroom with 33 five and six year olds.Two children were on holiday.After Assembly we had an interesting television programme 'Gather Round' about families. At play time I watched a group of children skipping:'Teddybear,Teddybear turn
